meanings.definition: To remove luster or shine from a material.
meanings.sent1: She delustered the fabric by using a special spray.
meanings.sent2: The cleaner delustered the silverware to give it a more matte finish.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved delustering a shiny coin to make it look dull.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds delustered the once bright sky, casting a shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes delustered the painting, creating a subtle and elegant effect.

meanings.definition: The process of making a fabric less shiny by adding a dull finish.
meanings.sent1: The delustering of the silk fabric gave it a more understated appearance.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer used delustering techniques to create a more sophisticated look.
meanings.sent3: The delustering of the curtains made the room feel cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent4: The delustering process transformed the glossy fabric into a more muted material.
meanings.sent5: The delustering of the tablecloth reduced the glare of the overhead lights, making the dining experience more pleasant.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing the brightness or sheen of something.
meanings.sent1: The delustering of the car's paint helped reduce the glare in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The delustering of the jewelry made it less flashy and more elegant.
meanings.sent3: The delustering of the floor tiles prevented any unwanted reflections.
meanings.sent4: The delustering of the screen protector minimized fingerprints and smudges.
meanings.sent5: The delustering of the packaging material made it less eye-catching on the store shelves.
